attributes.config: {"steps": [{"title": "Over time","description": "This dashboard will tell you the story of climate change over time and how the temperatures have changed over the last 40 years.","time": 3000,"operations": [{"op": "add","path": "/state/steps/Year_2/values","value": ["1980"]}]}, {"title": "1980","description": "World Climate Research Programme launched to coordinate international research.","time": 3000,"operations": [{"op": "add","path": "/state/steps/Year_2/values","value": ["1981"]}]}, {"title": "1981","description": "Strong global warming since mid-1970s is reported, with 1981 the warmest year on record.","time": 5000,"operations": [{"op": "add","path": "/state/steps/Year_2/values","value": ["1983"]}]}, {"title": "1983","description": "Reports from US National Academy of Sciences and Environmental Protection Agency spark conflict greenhouse warming becomes a factor in mainstream politics.","time": 5000,"operations": [{"op": "add","path": "/state/steps/Year_2/values","value": ["1985"]}]}, {"title": "1985","description": "Ramanathan and collaborators announce that global warming may come twice as fast as expected, from rise of methane and other trace greenhouse gases.","time": 3000,"operations": [{"op": "add","path": "/state/steps/Year_2/values","value": ["1986"]}]}, {"title": "1986","description": "Meltdown of reactor at Chernobyl (Soviet Union) cripples plans to replace fossil fuels with nuclear power.","time": 5000,"operations": [{"op": "add","path": "/state/steps/Year_2/values","value": ["1988"]}]}, {"title": "1988","description": "News media coverage of global warming leaps upward following record heat and droughts. UN launched its Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC).","time": 6000,"operations": [{"op": "add","path": "/state/steps/Year_2/values","value": ["1990"]}]}, {"title": "1990","description": "California Energy Comission predicted that the droughts, heatwaves, and wildfires they had experienced were likely to hit the state with more frequency in the years to come.","time": 5000,"operations": [{"op": "add","path": "/state/steps/Year_2/values","value": ["1992"]}]}, {"title": "1992","description": "The Rio Earth Summit — an international conference on sustainable development established a set of principles for improving and protecting the environment adopted by 178 countries.","time": 5000,"operations": [{"op": "add","path": "/state/steps/Year_2/values","value": ["1995"]}]}, {"title": "1995","description": "Second IPCC report detects signature of human-caused greenhouse effect warming, declares that serious warming is likely in the coming century.","time": 5000,"operations": [{"op": "add","path": "/state/steps/Year_2/values","value": ["1997"]}]}, {"title": "1997","description": "Toyota introduces Prius in Japan, first mass-market electric hybrid car swift progress in large wind turbines, solar electricity, and other energy alternatives.","time": 5000,"operations": [{"op": "add","path": "/state/steps/Year_2/values","value": ["1999"]}]}, {"title": "1999","description": "Global Climate Coalition dissolves as many corporations grapple with threat of warming, but oil lobby convinces US administration to ignore the problem.","time": 5000,"operations": [{"op": "add","path": "/state/steps/Year_2/values","value": ["2001"]}]}, {"title": "2001","description": "Warming observed in ocean basins match with computer models gives a clear signature of greenhouse effect warming.","time": 5000,"operations": [{"op": "add","path": "/state/steps/Year_2/values","value": ["2003"]}]}, {"title": "2003","description": "Numerous observations raise concern that collapse of ice sheets (West Antarctica, Greenland) can raise sea level faster than most had believed. ","time": 3000,"operations": [{"op": "add","path": "/state/steps/Year_2/values","value": ["2005"]}]}, {"title": "2005","description": "Hurricane Katrina and other major tropical storms spur debate over impact of global warming on storm intensity.","time": 3000,"operations": [{"op": "add","path": "/state/steps/Year_2/values","value": ["2006"]}]}, {"title": "2006","description": "China overtakes the United States as the world’s biggest emitter of CO2.","time": 3000,"operations": [{"op": "add","path": "/state/steps/Year_2/values","value": ["2008"]}]}, {"title": "2008","description": "Climate scientists (although not the public) recognize that even if all greenhouse gas emissions could be halted immediately, global warming will remain for millennia.","time": 3000,"operations": [{"op": "add","path": "/state/steps/Year_2/values","value": ["2011"]}]}, {"title": "2011","description": "Reaction to nuclear reactor disaster at Fukushima (Japan) ends hopes for a renaissance of nuclear power.","time": 3000,"operations": [{"op": "add","path": "/state/steps/Year_2/values","value": ["2013"]}]}, {"title": "2013","description": "An apparent pause or hiatus in global warming of the atmosphere since 1998, publicized by skeptics, is explained the world is still warming (as following years would confirm).","time": 3000,"operations": [{"op": "add","path": "/state/steps/Year_2/values","value": ["2015"]}]}, {"title": "2015","description": "Researchers find collapse of West Antarctic ice sheet may be irreversible, bringing meters of sea-level rise over future centuries.","time": 3000,"operations": [{"op": "add","path": "/state/steps/Year_2/values","value": ["2018"]}]}, {"title": "2018","description": "IPCC reported the world only had 12 years left to limit climate catastrophe before its consequences became irreversible.","time": 3000,"operations": [{"op": "add","path": "/state/steps/Year_2/values","value": ["2020"]}]}, {"title": "2020","description": "Mean global temperature is the warmest in tens of thousands of years.","time": 3000,"operations": [{"op": "add","path": "/state/steps/Year_2/values","value": []}]}, {"title": "Act now","description": "If we dont act soon, things will only get worse.","time": 0,"operations": []}]}

richTextContent.insert: Daily temperature data from ERA5 reanalysis data from Copernicus Climate Service. https://cds.climate.copernicus.eu
